RentJuice Capitalizes on the Rise of Renter Nation

Alex Salkever - Nov. 29, 2010

The percentage of Americans who own their homes has dropped big-time as a result of the foreclosure crisis, and no doubt it will drop further before it's all over. During the housing bubble, home ownership in America reached all-time highs. Now, real estate analysts expect the home ownership level to drop by 5%, give or take, due to tougher mortgage lending rules and the rash of foreclosures.
